thread.title: Donald Trump orders £43 billion boost to defence spending
thread.title_full: Donald Trump orders £43 billion boost to defence spending

author: Rob Crilly
title: Donald Trump orders £43 billion boost to defence spending
text:
News Donald Trump orders £43 billion boost to defence spending President Donald Trump arrives for a meeting of the National Governors Association on Monday, February 27 Credit: Evan Vucci/AP Photo Rob Crilly , New York 27 February 2017 • 3:51pm 
D onald Trump is ordering a $54 billion (£43 billion) surge in defence spending at the expense of environmental and foreign aid programmes as he tries to make good on the populist programme that propelled him to the White House. 
The budget outlines were being sent to departments on Monday and offer a chance to define the new president’s priorities after a first month in which he has been bold on rhetoric but weak on detail. 
An official from the Office of Management and Budget told reporters that it included an almost 10 per cent increase on the $600 billion defence budget. 
Earlier, officials said Mr Trump was demanding budget savings worth tens of millions of dollars at the Environmental Protection Agency and State Department, according to The New York Times, allowing the Pentagon to increase spending without eating into social safety net programmes – such as Medicare – that he promised to protect. 
Full details of the draft budget have not yet been made public. Agencies also have the chance to negotiate changes before the blueprint is published in March. Watch | Donald Trump says fake media is enemy of the people 00:18 
H owever, Mr Trump previewed his plans last week in a speech to the Conservative Political Action Conference. 
“We're also putting in a massive budget request for our beloved military. And we will be substantially upgrading all of our military, all of our military, offensive, defensive, everything. Bigger and better and stronger than ever before,” he said. 
Critics question whether there is any need for a big increase in Pentagon spending when the military budget already stands at $600 billion a year. Watch | General 'Mad Dog' Mattis sworn in as Trump's Defence Secretary 01:09 
B ut Mr Trump made rebuilding what he described as America’s “depleted” armed forces a central part of his campaign. 
On the stump, he called for 90,000 more soldiers, 100 more air force fighters and a 350-ship Navy (an increase on the 274 currently), as part of a build-up that would signal to the world that the US was no longer a soft touch. 
An official told Reuters that the request for the Pentagon included more money for shipbuilding, military aircraft and “a more robust presence in key international waterways and chokepoints” such as the Strait of Hormuz and South China Sea.
